title: Kyiv Planning for Total Evacuation if It Loses Electricity
description: The city is also establishing 1,000 heating centers for its 3 million residents, as Russia pounds away at civilian targets.

title: Far Right’s Rise in Israel Driven by Anxiety and Fear
description: To win election, Benjamin Netanyahu and his far-right allies harnessed perceived threats to Israel’s Jewish identity after ethnic unrest last year and the subsequent inclusion of Arab lawmakers in the government.

title: Astronomers Find a Black Hole in Our Cosmic Back Yard
description: Just 1,600 light-years away, the black hole is the closest known to Earth. The good news: It’s dormant, at least for now.

title: The U.S. and Europe seek to assure Ukraine of support.
North Korea Launches More Missiles
description: Tensions further escalated on the divided peninsula, with Washington deploying supersonic bombers for the first time in years as part of a military exercise.

title: Time Warp
description: How readers are adjusting to the end of daylight saving time.

title: Alleviating Canada’s Acute Shortage of Family Doctors
description: British Columbia announced a plan this week that will boost physicians’ incomes, but more changes may be necessary to increase nationwide access to family physicians.

title: Hosting Climate Summit Is Both Opportunity and Risk for Egypt
description: The COP27 meeting next week allows a debt-wracked African country to champion climate needs of poorer nations. But it also puts Egypt under scrutiny.

title: These Men Fled War in Syria to Ukraine. Now They’ve Fled Again.
description: Two men displaced from Syria as civil war gripped their country spent a decade living in limbo in Ukraine. But when war came to them again, they were forced to leave, eventually making their way to London.

title: U.S. and Allies Reassure Ukraine of Staunch Support
description: Soaring energy prices resulting from the war have raised concerns that the flow of weapons and money could slow down.

title: Itaewon Goes Quiet After Deadly Crowd Crush in Seoul, South Korea
description: Itaewon was popular for its diversity and nightlife. A week after a disaster killed more than 150 young people there, the neighborhood is a monument of grief.

title: What Can US Democracy Learn From Brazil?
description: Both nations had presidents who attacked their elections. But their responses — and the aftermaths — were much different.

title: Republican Gains in Congress Would Pressure Biden on Ukraine and Iran
description: Officials in the Biden administration expect plenty of complications, including summons to hearings over the U.S. withdrawal from Afghanistan.
